nodes.text: That was one hell of a rough ride. My stomach is still doing somersaults.

That's because those crazy bastards used a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePiratePoint],pirate point]] to get us here. If we'd suffered a misjump, a sour stomach would be the least of your concerns… the Leopard could've gotten irreparably mangled. Hell, we could've been irreparably mangled. The cautionary Holovids they showed us at the Academy were the stuff of nightmares.

branches.responseText: When, exactly, did you realize what Centrella's JumpShip crew was planning on doing?
I'm sure they were, but we're fine. Save your concern for the job ahead.
We're mercenaries. Our job carries an assumption of risk.

nodes.text:
As we were on our approach to dock with the JumpShip. It was way out of position to use any legitimate jump point.

Putting two and two together, I could guess at what they were going to do.

branches.responseText: [Origin: Accident] The next time this happens, you tell me about it before we jump. I'd rather eat a bullet than go out the way my parents did.
Here's the million C-Bill question, Meyer. Why didn't you say anything about this before we jumped?
Well, anyway. We're here now, so let's move forward.

nodes.text:
Yes, Commander… of course. Sorry.

But… we couldn't afford to turn down this job. I thought that, given the situation, ignorance was probably bliss.

We'll talk about this later, Meyer. But for now, what's done is done. We're here, and there's money to be made.

Let's focus on the task at hand.

Because it wouldn't have mattered if I had. We couldn't afford to turn down this job.

Given the situation, I figured that ignorance was probably bliss.

We'll talk about this later, Meyer. But for now, what's done is done. We're here, and there's money to be made.

Let's focus on the task at hand.
You heard the Commander—everybody pay attention. We've got a job to discuss.
You heard the Commander—stow the complaints. And pay attention… we have a job to discuss.
[A grainy map of a barren moon fills your viewscreen. A section of the image has been highlighted in white.]

The Scheria's's crash site is here, smack dab in the middle of a pirate stronghold. The ship, the stronghold, and everything around it belong to a self-styled bandit queen called Grim Sybil. Her gang is the closest thing that Axylus has to a ruling council.

"Grim Sybil"? Is that supposed to be scary? It sounds like the kind of name you'd choose out of a hat.

What do their defenses look like?

They're patchy at best. I don't think that Axylus gets a lot of visitors.

They have strong anti-air cover, but little in the way of ground-based defenses. I'm seeing a lot of vehicles, but BattleMech activity looks light.

branches.responseText: Define "light" BattleMech activity. What are we talking about, exactly?
What else do you have on Grim Sybil? Before today, I'd never heard of her.
So the pirates have vehicles and turrets, maybe a few BattleMechs. Got it. Keep going.

nodes.text: I can't put an exact number on it—all I have are surface scans to go on. From what data I do have, I'd expect the pirates to be able to field a full lance of light BattleMechs, all of them in poor repair. There are mixed reports of something bigger—that'll be Grim Sybil's 'Mech. I don't have any information on tonnage or armament. But given the shape that everything else is in on Axylus, I imagine it's being held together with chewing gum and baling wire.

Yeah, I hadn't, either. Centrella's intel says that Grim Sybil mostly stays put on Axylus. But she's got at least a dozen pirate gangs operating under her banner, so she must have something going for her.

Sybil's bio is pretty sparse… there isn't a lot of meat here. Just a note that she came up under Lady Paula Trevaline, the Pirate Queen of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTortugaDominion],Tortuga Dominions]].

I guess that's impressive, having a personal connection to [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLadyDeath],Lady Death]] and all.

"Lady Death"? Really?

 I swear, man, these pirate names are killing me.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Frontier Pirate]</color> You don't know the half of it, Yang. Spend a few years hanging out with my old friends, and believe me… you'll hear worse.
What do you expect, Yang? They're pirates, not poets… their only real job requirement is a willingness to kill for money.
Are MechWarrior callsigns really any better, Yang?
Keep going, Darius. What else have you found?

nodes.text:
One of these days, you're gonna have to tell me more about your past, Boss.

…Actually, check that. I'm not sure I wanna know.
Darius, is there anything else worth mentioning in that file? Or can we get back to talking about the mission?

Yeah, I guess that's true. Fair enough.

Is there anything else of interest in that file, Darius? Don't leave us in suspense.

Hmm. Lemme think about that one, Boss. "{COMMANDER.Callsign}." 

No… no, I guess they're not.

Very clever, wiseass. Now knock it off.

Darius, is there anything else worth mentioning in that file? Or can we get back to talking about the mission?

Well, it looks like Trevaline and Sybil had a falling out… that's not terribly surprising, given the Pirate Queen's track record.

Sybil managed to survive somehow—good on her—and she's been living on Axylus ever since.

The rest of the report is just a rap sheet. Apparently, our bandit queen has racked up an astonishing number of kills over the years… mostly against merchants and freighter crews, but kills all the same.

She likes to get her hands dirty, and she knows her way around a BattleMech. And that's all I've got.

The entire structure is surrounded by radar-guided antiaircraft guns. Your first task will be to take down the radar towers so that Sumire can approach the derelict. After you've secured the crash site, she'll dock with the Scheria and drop off the engineering team.
…And then they'll miraculously get a two-hundred-year-old wreck flying again.

Lady Centrella has bet a massive stack of [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreCBill],C-Bills]] that they will. For what it's worth, I believe Dr. Murad can pull this off. The Doc has built herself quite a reputation, including for her work here on the Argo. She's a genius at bringing dead ships back to life.

Genius? Why thank you, Darius. I don't think anyone has called me that before.

But I'm confident we can get it off the ground, Commander. Star League era ships were built to last. I'll get it done.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Rimward Periphery]</color> Periphery ingenuity at work, huh? Can't wait to see this you in action, Doctor.
I'll believe it when I see it, but for what it's worth, I hope you're right.
I guess we'll find out, won't we?
branches.comment: BG: Not FWL, Not DC, Not LC, Not CC, not RWP

nodes.text: Good hunting, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. I'll be keeping an eye on you from up here.

Yeah, me too. Now that we're here, we're kind of committed to seeing this job through.

I'll leave you to it, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Good hunting on the moon's surface… I'll be keeping an eye on you from up here.
For better or worse, yes we will. I'll leave you to it, {COMMANDER.FirstName}… good hunting on the moon's surface. I'll be keeping an eye on you from up here.

I'm glad to hear it, because it's gonna have to be. Now that we're here, we're kind of committed to seeing this job through.

I'll leave you to it, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Good hunting on the moon's surface… I'll be keeping an eye on you from up here.
